title: Signal Co-Founder Moxie Marlinspike Launches Confer: A Privacy-First AI Challenger to ChatGPT

paragraphs.content: Moxie Marlinspike, the cryptographer behind Signal and WhatsApp's encryption protocol, has unveiled Confer, an end-to-end encrypted AI chatbot designed as a direct alternative to ChatGPT. Launched in December 2025, Confer ensures servers never access or retain user conversations, preventing data use for training models or targeted advertising. This approach mimics ChatGPT's familiar interface while deploying secure enclaves for cloud-based AI inference accessible only to users.

primarySource.name: TechCrunch AI
primarySource.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT

additionalSources.name: techcrunch
additionalSources.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT

paragraphs.content: Confer's free tier caps users at 20 messages per day and five active chats, with a paid plan at $35 monthly unlocking unlimited access, advanced models, and personalizationâ€”steeper than ChatGPT Plus or Claude Pro at $20 each. Marlinspike warns that mainstream AI chats resemble group conversations involving executives, hackers, advertisers, and governments, despite users' perceptions of privacy. The service builds on his Signal legacy to address rising concerns over AI data practices, including OpenAI's ad experiments.

primarySource.name: cryptorank
primarySource.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT

additionalSources.name: time
additionalSources.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT

sections.title: Confer's Encryption Backbone and Usage Limits

paragraphs.content: Confer employs WebAuthn passkeys for authentication, optimized for mobile and macOS Sequoia, with password manager workarounds for Windows and Linux users. All inference runs in trusted execution environments with remote attestation to verify integrity, using open-weight models tailored to tasks without user selection. This setup guarantees no conversation storage or leaks, even under legal demands, contrasting sharply with competitors' 30-day retention policies.

primarySource.name: privacyguides
primarySource.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT

additionalSources.name: techcrunch
additionalSources.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT

paragraphs.content: The free model's responses echo early ChatGPT styles, such as "It's not X, it's Y" phrasing, though lacking some dynamism compared to top proprietary options. Paid subscribers gain access to superior models on benchmarks like MMLU and GSM8K, alongside personalization features. Privacy advocates praise this as a "clean break" from surveillance-driven AI paradigms.

primarySource.name: boingboing
primarySource.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT

additionalSources.name: findarticles
additionalSources.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT

sections.title: Privacy Advocates Champion Confer Amid AI Data Alarms

paragraphs.content: PrivacyGuides.org hailed Confer as "the most private on the market" during a January 16, 2026 livestream, linking it to trends like a new privacy services alliance involving Windscribe and Kagi. Boing Boing described it as end-to-end encrypted AI chat combating surveillance, leveraging Marlinspike's cryptographic reputation. Forum discussions on PrivacyGuides note its speed advantages over rivals like Proton Lumo despite encryption overhead.

primarySource.name: careeraheadonline
primarySource.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT

additionalSources.name: aol
additionalSources.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT

paragraphs.content: Marlinspike positions Confer to replicate Signal's industry influence, potentially sparking a "race to the top" in user privacy against Big Tech dominance. TIME suggests it could reshape AI ecosystems by prioritizing trust as a premium, even as ChatGPT holds 64.5% market traffic amid Gemini's rise. Critics flag the free tier's limitations and higher costs but see version-one promise in its architectural innovations.
